body:
Hello! We have been investigating this issue due to this report on the Minecraft bug tracker: [MC-265519](https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-265519). Not totally sure what has gone wrong here, but wanted to share our findings ðŸ™‚ 
* It does not seem to be specifically related to the version of MacOS, but rather based on monitor configuration / screen resolution - it is possible to reproduce or not reproduce the issue on the same device with different screen or resolution setups
* The issue was introduced at some point between version 3.3.6 and 3.3.8 (suspicion is [this commit](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/commit/0d599026d04ddcc2695ae938fc1864523dab7a34), but have not confirmed this)
* The [NSWindowStyleMaskResizable](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nswindowstylemask/nswindowstylemaskresizable) style flag seems to be related - explicitly removing it when in fullscreen mode seems to restore to previous behaviour
  * The resizable flag does actually allow the window to be resized even when in fullscreen mode, which is a bit of a fun experience ðŸ˜„

> Hello! We have been investigating this issue due to this report on the Minecraft bug tracker: [MC-265519](https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-265519). Not totally sure what has gone wrong here, but wanted to share our findings ðŸ™‚
> 
> * It does not seem to be specifically related to the version of MacOS, but rather based on monitor configuration / screen resolution - it is possible to reproduce or not reproduce the issue on the same device with different screen or resolution setups
> * The issue was introduced at some point between version 3.3.6 and 3.3.8 (suspicion is [this commit](https://github.com/glfw/glfw/commit/0d599026d04ddcc2695ae938fc1864523dab7a34), but have not confirmed this)
> * The [NSWindowStyleMaskResizable](https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nswindowstylemask/nswindowstylemaskresizable) style flag seems to be related - explicitly removing it when in fullscreen mode seems to restore to previous behaviour
>   
>   * The resizable flag does actually allow the window to be resized even when in fullscreen mode, which is a bit of a fun experience ðŸ˜„

Wow, good catch; I'll test this in my own engine codebase and report if it fixes it with my code.

If it does I'll see if I can author a patch for GLFW.

UPDATE: Can confirm masking out NSWindowStyleMaskResizable on GLFW's native Cocoa handle works and gets rid of the minimise bug. I'll author a patch to address this properly but for now my game engine has a workaround for when fullscreen mode is entered.

UPDATE 2: Pull request opened; the fix was surprisingly simple.

rename.from: MacOS Catalina: Window minimizes when clicked but only if the program starts in fullscreen.
rename.to: MacOS Catalina: Window minimizes when clicked.

issue.title: Not clearing NSWindowStyleMaskResizable when entering fullscreen causes issues on 10.15 Catalina

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Bug reports and bugfix pull requests

repository.name: glfw
repository.description: A multi-platform library for OpenGL, OpenGL ES, Vulkan, window and input

issue.body:
On macOS Catalina and earlier, not having the resizable bit cleared in NSWindowStyleMask in fullscreen leads to windows minimising when clicked anywhere in the content area. This affects both my game engine and reportedly Minecraft, as detailed in issue #2377

This fix doesn't (and shouldn't need to) apply to windows created in a fullscreen state as createNativeWindow in cocoa_window.m defines a default styleMask before altering it according to desired GLFW window hints and settings.

This hasn't been tested on newer macOS versions for regressions but should otherwise work there.

rename.from: MacOS Catalina: Window minimizes when clicked.
rename.to: Fullscreen window minimizes when clicked on 10.15 Catalina

body: Thank you both! This should be fixed now with #2405. I added you to the credits with 7b152019dab027dfd276e37cacaacd439075f6c3. Please let me know if you would like your credit line changed.
Sorry, only just saw this. Credits line looks good!
